summary: This is a court order from the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit regarding the appeal in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It orders the United States to submit an amicus brief regarding Maxwell's arguments and motion to consolidate appeals, sets response deadlines, and adjourns a scheduled hearing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant appealing her case, with the court ordering the United States to submit a brief regarding her arguments and motion to consolidate appeals.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Presiding judge (J.) for the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York in the underlying case.

persons.name: Sharon Churcher
persons.context: Listed as a respondent in the appeal case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a respondent in the appeal case, deceased co-conspirator.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor in the appeal case, likely a journalist.

persons.name: Alan M. Dershowitz
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor in the appeal case, a prominent attorney.

persons.name: Michael Cemovich
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor, doing business as Cemovich Media.

persons.name: Catherine O'Hagan Wolfe
persons.context: Clerk of Court for the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit who issued the order.

connections.description: Both are central figures in the criminal case, with Maxwell being Epstein's alleged accomplice.
Dershowitz is listed as an intervenor in Maxwell's appeal, indicating a legal interest in the proceedings.

events.title: Court Issues Order on Appeal Briefing
events.description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit orders the United States to submit an amicus brief regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal arguments and her motion to consolidate appeals.

events.title: Deadline for U.S. Amicus Brief
events.description: The United States is ordered to submit its amicus letter brief by this date.

events.title: Hearing Adjourned
events.description: A hearing scheduled for this date is adjourned until further order of the court.

events.title: Deadline for Party Responses
events.description: The parties to the appeal are ordered to respond to the U.S. amicus brief by this date.

locations: Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY
keyFacts: The court ordered the United States to submit an amicus brief regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal arguments and her motion to consolidate her appeal (20-2413) with another case (20-3061).
Several parties, including journalists Sharon Churcher and Julie Brown, and attorney Alan Dershowitz, are formally listed as respondents or intervenors in the appeal.
A hearing scheduled for September 22, 2020, was adjourned indefinitely by this order.
The document is a procedural order from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, indicating the ongoing appellate litigation in Maxwell's case post-arrest.
